events.text: Red comments explain something that's seems counter intuitive.
Blue comments are something we could try.
Default formatted comments are brief summaries of functionality in plain English.

events.name: ALL_PARAMETERS
events.comment: The index of the parameter to forward in function calls in order to forward all parameters.

events.name: ANIMATION_DIVISOR
events.comment: The number by which to divide the movement speed to obtain the animation speed.

events.name: ARC
events.comment: The number of degrees in a circle divided by the number of angles our assets have.

events.name: AUDIO_FADE_TIME
events.comment: The duration of audio fade-ins and fade-outs, in seconds.

events.name: DEFAULT_STEREO_PAN
events.comment: The default value for the stereo pan audio parameter.

events.name: ELLIPSIS_UPDATE_INTERVAL
events.comment: How often to add an additional ellipsis dot, in seconds.

events.name: END_OF_TICK
events.comment: The amount of time remaining until the end of the current tick, in seconds.

events.name: HALF_CIRCLE
events.comment: The number of degrees in half of a circle.

events.name: INFINITE_REPEAT_COUNT
events.comment: The value needed for a tween to repeat forever.

events.name: INTERACT_COOLDOWN
events.comment: How frequently to let the player interact with things, in seconds.

events.name: ISOMETRIC_DIVIDER
events.comment: The number by which to divide projectile's and character's height to be properly isometric.

events.name: LAYOUT_FADE_TIME
events.comment: The duration of the fade-in and fade-out between layouts, in seconds.

events.name: LOOP_OFFSET
events.comment: For loops that need to either start or end at an offset.

events.name: LOOP_DEFAULT
events.comment: The default number for loops to start at.

events.name: MENU_FADE_TIME
events.comment: The duration of fade-ins and fade-outs of menus, in seconds.

events.name: NON_DIRECTIONAL_INNER_ANGLE
events.comment: The inner angle audio parameter for non-directional position-based sound.

events.name: NON_DIRECTIONAL_OUTER_ANGLE
events.comment: The outer angle audio parameter for non-directional position-based sound.

events.name: NON_DIRECTIONAL_OUTER_GAIN
events.comment: The outer gain audio parameter for non-directional position-based sound.

events.name: PAUSED
events.comment: The value of the timescale when the game is paused.

events.name: PERCENTAGE_DIVIDER
events.comment: Used when converting percentage modifiers to flat values.

events.name: QUARTER_CIRCLE
events.comment: The number of degrees in a quarter of a circle.

events.name: SILENT
events.comment: The decibel value necessary for audio to make no sound.

events.name: SOLID_OPACITY
events.comment: The opacity value of complete solidity.

events.name: TRANSPARENT_OPACITY
events.comment: The opacity value of complete transparency.

events.name: TWEEN_REPEAT_COUNT
events.comment: How many times that tweens should repeat.

events.name: ALL_CLASSES_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used when checking if the player can equip an item or not.

events.name: BLANK
events.comment: Empty text.

events.name: CHECKED_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used for checking the animation of checkboxes.

events.name: EITHER_CURLY_BRACKET_REGEX
events.comment: A regular expression to match either curly bracket.

events.name: ELLIPSIS
events.comment: An ellipsis.

events.name: ELLIPSIS_DOT
events.comment: The character used to form ellipses.

events.name: EMPTY
events.comment: The slot identifier value that indicates this slot is empty.

events.name: ENEMY_ABILITIES_FUNCTION_MAP
events.comment: The name of the enemy abilities function map.

events.name: EQUIPMENT_MODS_FUNCTION_MAP
events.comment: The name of the equipment mods function map.

events.name: EQUIPMENT_PROBABILITY_TABLE
events.comment: The name of the equipment probability table.

events.name: FIRST_INSTANCE
events.comment: The index of first instance of the current picked objects.

events.name: FOLDER_SEPARATOR
events.comment: The character used when drilling into project folders.

events.name: GLOBAL_FLAG
events.comment: The regular expression global flag.

events.name: GLOWHORIZONTAL_KEYWORD
events.comment: The name of the effect that modifies the horizontal glow on an object.

events.name: GLOWVERTICAL_KEYWORD
events.comment: The name of the effect that modifies the vertical glow on an object.

events.name: IDLE_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used for calling the idle animation for the player, NPCs, and some enemies.

events.name: ITEM_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used when creating items.

events.name: MENU_CLOSE_TAG
events.comment: Audio tag to use for the menu close sound effect.

events.name: MOD_VALUES_PROBABILITY_TABLE
events.comment: The name of the mod values probability table.

events.name: MOD_TABLE_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used for creating and fetching mod tables.

events.name: NONE_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used as a default or empty value for various other variables.

events.name: NOT_USED
events.comment: Value to use when this field isn't utilized.

events.name: OPACITY_FADE_OUT_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used for opacity tween tags.

events.name: PLAYER_ABILITIES_FUNCTION_MAP
events.comment: The name of the player abilities function map.

events.name: UNCHECKED_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used for checking the animation of checkboxes.

events.name: SEPARATOR
events.comment: The character used for most string delimitation, or improving readability.

events.name: SIMPLE_NAME_KEYWORD
events.comment: Used for looking up simple names out of arrays.

events.name: dialogVolume
events.comment: How loudly to play dialog, in decibels.

events.name: effectsVolume
events.comment: How loudly to play sound effects, in decibels.

events.name: interfaceVolume
events.comment: How loudly to place interface sound effects, in decibels.

events.name: musicVolume
events.comment: How loudly to play the music, in decibels.

events.name: nextAvailableIdentifier
events.comment: Stores the next available identifier, to be assigned to equipment.

events.name: uidOfClicked
events.comment: The UID of the object that the player clicked.

events.name: isOnInteractCooldown
events.comment: Whether or not the player is allowed to interact with objects.

children.name: PORTRAIT_KEYWORD
children.comment: Used for interacting with the portrait layer.

children.name: MESSAGE_COLUMN_HEADER
children.comment: The header of the column that contains NPC messages.

children.name: PORTRAIT_POSITION
children.comment: The position on the X axis of where the portrait should spawn

actions.text: Close the merchant menu if the player gets too far away from the merchant to whose shop is being displayed.
Don't execute if the portrait is fading out. Pick only the NPC and corresponding body that the player is talking to, to check if they were clicked in the next subevent.

children.name: DIALOG_COUNTER_INCREMENTER
children.comment: By how much to increase the dialog counter for each NPC dialog.

actions.text: If this NPC doesn't have any more dialog, close the dialog.
Lazy man's solution to one of our never ending hierarchal tween opacity issues.

children.name: VIEWPORT_OFFSET
children.comment: How much to offset the portrait from the bottom of the viewport, in pixels.

actions.text: TODO: If all NPCs never have anything more than just the idle animation, we can change this to self.animationName
parent it to the dialog so it resizes correctly

children.name: INITIAL_DIALOG_COUNTER_VALUE
children.comment: The number at which the dialog counter begins.

children.functionDescription: End dialog with an NPC.

actions.text: This wait being the official recommended method to unload an object after destroying it.

children.name: allowEquipmentInteraction
children.comment: Whether or not the player is currently allowed to interact with equipment

children.name: swapIdentifier
children.comment: The saved identifier for swapping.

children.name: swapSlotUid
children.comment: the UID of the original slot in a swap

children.name: draggedOriginSlotUid
children.comment: the UID of the slot the drag originated from

children.name: draggedItemUid
children.comment: the UID of the item we're dragging

children.name: droppedOnSlotUid
children.comment: the UID of the slot we dropped on

children.functionDescription: Picking up loot and turning it into an item

children.name: OBTAINED_ITEM_KEYWORD
children.comment: Used for playing the sound effect when an item is obtained.

actions.text: if auto equip is enabled, and the player's class matches the loot's restrictions, pick the first empty slot matching the loot's type, and spawn the item there
if auto equip is disabled, or there's no empty slots matching the item's type, spawn the item in the first empty inventory slot.

children.functionDescription: set the variables on an item, from its loot

children.name: TRAVEL_TIME
children.comment: The amount of time it takes loot to get to its destination.

actions.text: This isn't a part of the 'spawnLoot' function because we need it to work for loot that's already in a layout.

children.functionDescription: spawn loot at the specified location

functionParameters.name: lootDistance
functionParameters.comment: How far away from the object to spawn loot.

actions.text: TODO: lootDistance should be the smallest isometric circle (oval) that completely encompasses the object that spawned the loot.

children.name: LOOT_ALTITUDE
children.comment: How high the loot should fly up into the air after it spawns.

actions.text: https://github.com/Laserwolve-Games/DaggerQuest/issues/38

children.name: MIN_MODS
children.comment: The minimum number of mods an item can have.

children.name: MAX_MODS
children.comment: The maximum number of mods an item can have.

children.name: chosenMod
children.comment: The mod chosen to be added to this loot.

children.name: SQUARE_BRACKET_REGEX
children.comment: A regular expression to get everything between square brackets.

children.name: modValue
children.comment: The text inside the brackets of a given mod.

actions.text: for each set of square brackets in this loot's mods

children.name: lowerLimit
children.comment: the lowest number that this mod can roll

children.name: MOD_SEPARATOR
children.comment: The character used to indicate a range in a numerical mod value.

children.name: upperLimit
children.comment: the highest number that this mod can roll

actions.text: if this particular value contains the mod separator, it's a numeric value

children.text: Set a numeric mod's value to a random number between the lower and upper limit. Higher numbers are rarer. The rarity of higher numbers diminishingly scales with the loot level.
TODO: Negative values - should lower numbers be better? or worse?

children.name: total
children.comment: the total weight of all possible mod values, unconverted

actions.text: the number of Xs in the mod value is the number of decimal places to shift the result. We have to do it this way because of floating point math problems
We can remove an entire mod table, so remove the entries the same way we added them

children.text: For text mod values, select a choice at random

actions.text: if it doesn't, it should contain a dollar sign, which means it's a text value

children.functionDescription: Standardize the possible value of a mod to a uniform range

functionParameters.name: lowerLimit
functionParameters.comment: the lowest number that this mod can roll

functionParameters.name: upperLimit
functionParameters.comment: the highest number that this mod can roll

functionParameters.name: currentLoopindex
functionParameters.comment: the loopindex of the current loop over possible mod values

children.title: merchants
children.description: There can only be one merchants per layout. We generate/refresh that merchant's inventory (the merchant menu) on the start of that layout.

actions.text: At the start of each layout, if this layout has a merchant NPC, pick all the slots and items on the merchant menu. Destroy all the items that are currently on there, if any; they're from the previous layout.
if an item is right clicked while it's not being dragged, and the inventory menu is open...
...if the equipped menu is open...
...and the item is in the equipped menu...
check to see if there's any empty inventory slots the item can go into
if there are, detach the item from its current slot
then attach it to the first empty inventory slot
"I can't carry any more"

...and the item is in the in the inventory menu...
This else is necessary so that only one thing happens to the item per right click.
...and can be equipped...
pick the equipped menu slots that match the item's type
of those slots, check if any are empty
now that we know there's an empty equipped menu slot for this item, go back to the inventory menu slot holding our item, and detach
re-pick the first empty equipped menu slot that matches the item's type, and attach to it

if no slots are empty, start a swap. pick the first equipped menu slot (necessary in the case of rings, because there are two slots) and store its identifier, which is also the identifier of the item in it
go back to the slot holding our item, and detach. save this slots UID so we know where to put the other item
re-pick the first equipped menu slot that matches the item's type, and attach to it, even though it has an different item in it

now we have both items in the same slot. we'll detach the item that shouldn't be there, picking it with swapID. We don't need to clear the identifier value because it was already set correctly in the previous event
"I don't meet the requirements for this item"
...if the merchant menu is open...
...and the item is in the merchant menu...
check to see if there's any empty inventory slots the item can go into
Check if the player can pay for the item, and if so, charge them
if there are, detach the item from its current slot
then attach it to the first empty inventory slot
"I have insufficient gold" - we possibly could include this in the transaction function
"I can't carry any more" or "I have no room for this purchase"

...and the item is in the in the inventory menu...
This else is necessary so that only one thing happens to the item per right click.
pick the slots on the merchant menu
pick the empty slots
now that we know there's an empty merchant menu slot for this item, go back to the inventory menu slot holding our item, and detach
re-pick the first empty merchant menu slot that matches the item's type, and attach to it, and TODO: give the player money for the item they just sold
if there's no empty slots on the merchant menu, the merchant plays the dialog line "I have no more room to purchase items"
"I don't meet the requirements for this item"
when an item starts being dragged, record where it came from, set dragging to true, and detach it
This ensures whatever is being dragged is always on top
if the item was dropped over a slot...
and that slot's type was none, or it's the same as the item's type, and the player meets all the requirements to equip it...
if the slot that was dropped over is on the merchant menu...
...and it's empty, put the item there...
and give the player the appropriate amount of coins if the item didn't originally also come from the merchant menu
...and it's not empty. send the item back. We don't swap items from the merchant menu.
if the item that was dropped came from the merchant menu...
...and it was dropped an an empty slot...
charge the player for the item and give it to them, provided they have enough coins
"I don't have enough coins for this purchase"
...and it was dropped on a slot that wasn't empty, return it. No swapping from the merchant menu.
only allow drag and drop swapping when neither the origin or destination slot are on the merchant menu
and that slot is not empty, save its identifier (which is also its item's identifier) so we can overwrite it
check if the item can go back to the origin slot
if it can, re-pick the item being dragged, and the slot we dropped it on, and attach them
now pick and detach the overlapped item that shouldn't be there (but the slot's identifier is OK), and pick the origin slot, and attach the two
if it can't, don't swap, and send the item being dragged back to the origin slot
send the item back to the slot it came from
Can't have an else condition in an OR block
if the item was dropped on an invalid location, send the item back to the slot it came from
if the item is dropped over the background, and it didn't come from the merchant menu, turn it into loot.
transfer data from item to loot, then destroy the item
Prevent items from being dropped outside the game window.

children.functionDescription: Determine whether a specified item can go into a specified slot. Returns 1 for true and 0 for false.

parameters.value: item.level <= player.level & slot.type = item.type & (Functions.contains(item.classRestrictions, ALL_CLASSES_KEYWORD) | Functions.contains(item.classRestrictions, body.ObjectTypeName))

children.functionDescription: Send a dragged item back to the slot from which it came.
attaches an item to a slot
detaches an item from a slot

children.title: gear
children.description: Warning: Using variables and functions to clean up these events leads to bizarre timing issues that are hard to troubleshoot.

children.functionDescription: Add a request to manage gear to the queue

actions.text: as long as the slot's type is not neck or ring...

children.name: allowGearManagement
children.comment: Whether or not the below events are currently running.

actions.text: if there's an item in this slot, spawn its gear
This won't destroy the gear that was just created. Only gear(s) that pertained to this slot beforehand get destroyed.

children.text: We are playing the equip noise for the item that just got equipped right now, so we don't need to play an unequip noise.

actions.text: If there's no item in this slot...
...and the slot is legs or head, or chest and not a man, (the slots that have default gear), load the default gear
...destroy the (non-default) gear that was affiliated with this slot. This won't destroy the default gear that was just created.

weird positioning because we only want the unequip audio to play if it isn't playing already, and only if non-default gear is getting destroyed, but we don't need to wait until it's unloaded from memory to play this.
If there's no default gear for this slot, just destroy the gear and then we're done

weird positioning because we only want the unequip audio to play if it isn't playing already, and only if non-default gear is getting destroyed, but we don't need to wait until it's unloaded from memory to play this.
If there was no gear to destroy, the item was (probably?) unequipped before its gear could load. We don't need to do anything, except allow gear management again.

children.functionDescription: Modify a value based on an angle, to make it isometrically correct.

functionParameters.name: value
functionParameters.comment: The value, which will be modified by the specified angle.

functionParameters.name: theAngle
functionParameters.comment: The angle, which will be used to modify the specified value.

actions.text: "theAngle" because "angle" is a reserved keyword.
This event needs to be above the sorting group to prevent a graphical glitch
This event must be below the above event, or else the loot will flash when the z order of its parent prop changes.
If a piece of loot is on the 'main' layer, it's part of the environment, and needs to be moved in front of whatever it's 'on', i.e., the prop that is its parent.

children.title: sorting
children.description: Check for edge cases to indicate utilization of a custom sorting order, otherwise use the default.

actions.text: The normal sorting order.

children.text: We have lots of variables, like uidOfClicked, that should be scoped down onto the player.

children.functionDescription: Update the facing of the player.

actions.text: this is a function so it can be called in the middle of an ability function
Regenerate health and mana while not at the maximum values.
Regenerate health only when alive.
isometrically correct movement
we could use frame tags to tag the footsteps frame appropriately, and then compare the current frame's tag instead of the raw frame number, but we'd have to write a tool to bulk update frame tags
We can only interact with loot chests that haven't been opened
only allow movement when no items are being dragged

'cursor is not over player' is a quick and dirty solution to prevent a glitchy animation when the mouse is held down very near player.x and player.y. The reason it's here and not with the other 'cursor is over' checkers to making picking up loot under the player easier.

Technically it should be an isometric circle around the player. The size of this isometric circle would be based on the players movement speed; the faster the player is moving, the larger the circle would need to be to prevent this animation.

Maybe with a very high movement speed, the circle would get too big and feel bad to use?
if the mouse isn't over any of the specified, reset uidOfClicked and walk there normally
As soon as the enemy comes in range, stop moving and attack it. We must verify we're in a non-combat area and have a weapon equipped before we get to the basicAttack function.

parameters.value: Functions.isInRange((player.pickupRange + max(loot.Width, loot.Height)) + loot.verticalHeight, loot.X, loot.Y)

actions.text: loot gets a bonus to its pick up range based on its size, and an additional bonus if it has a vertical height

Reset `uidOfClicked` if the player isn't moving. Otherwise, if the clicked object later entered into the player's interact range by its own locomotion, the player would interact with it. Give a small leeway timer to assist with interacting with objects the player is immediately next to.

children.functionDescription: Move to a location, specifying a distance away from that location to arrive at

functionParameters.name: x
functionParameters.comment: The coordinate on the X axis to move the player to

functionParameters.name: y
functionParameters.comment: The coordinate on the Y axis to move the player to

children.functionDescription: Prevent the player from doing anything.
Reinstate the player's ability to be controlled.

actions.text: this function can't be inside of 'movement and interaction'

If we're not paused or in a non-combat area, check if the keycode for each abilityKeybinder is pressed, and if it is, find the correlating abilitySlot, and ability. Use that ability to call the right player ability function.
This doesn't need to be done every tick, however, we are already looping over all abilities and keybinders.

children.title: man abilities
children.description: I'm hesitant to implement DRY principles for abilities as it may spaghettify to the point of unreadability. Compartmentalizing each ability in isolation might facilitate bug squashing and feature implementation in this area.

children.name: PROJECTILE_SPEED
children.comment: The speed of the projectile

children.name: MANIFESTATION_FRAME
children.comment: The (0-based) frame in which the projectile should manifest

children.name: SIZE
children.comment: The size of the projectile

children.name: waitPeriod
children.comment: How long to wait (in seconds) after the start of the animation before generating the projectile

actions.text: must have a weapon equipped
Don't set uidOfClicked to 0 here, because we might have clicked on an enemy
Extract the multiplier from the description in the abilities table

children.name: PROJECTILE_SPEED
children.comment: The speed of the projectile

children.comment: How long to wait (in seconds) after the start of the animation before generating the projectile

actions.text: must have a weapon equipped and enough mana
Extract the multiplier from the description in the abilities table

children.name: PROJECTILE_SPEED
children.comment: The speed of the projectile

children.name: MANIFESTATION_FRAME
children.comment: The (0-based) frame in which the projectile should manifest

children.name: SIZE
children.comment: The size of the projectile

children.comment: How long to wait (in seconds) after the start of the animation before generating the projectile

actions.text: must have enough mana
Extract the multiplier from the description in the abilities table
...if they were not where they were last tick, set their animation appropriately. Using the moveTo 'Is moving' condition causes the player to continue the walking animation when grinding into solids.
TODO: This won't work if we have an ability we can cancel by moving.
if they were idling, start the animation from the beginning
if they were already walking, play the animation from the current frame
If the player isn't moving and not dead, and they were previously walking, (and the game isn't paused) make him start idling.
Compensate for floating point math: https://github.com/Scirra/Construct-3-bugs/issues/5895
See bookmarked comment in Enemy Behaviors for the reason behind using triggers instead of in-line waits.
TODO: restart the level or send the player somewhere and revive them

children.functionDescription: Play an animation where the player is uncontrollable.

functionParameters.name: animationName
functionParameters.comment: The animation to play.

functionParameters.name: animationName
functionParameters.comment: which animation to play

functionParameters.name: animationSpeed
functionParameters.comment: how fast the animation plays

functionParameters.name: playFromBeginning
functionParameters.comment: Whether or not to play this animation from its beginning.

actions.text: startPoint is a string because it needs to get passed from an ability. Only update the animation if the player isn't current blocking or getting hitstunned.
this has to be done after the animation is set, so it goes in a blank event, instead of repeating it

children.functionDescription: Whether or not the player's body is currently playing the specified animation.

functionParameters.name: animationName
functionParameters.comment: The animation name to check for.

children.text: When we add other classes: make a (basically) empty layout that we go to after the player chooses their class. Don't unhide the loading screen so the player never sees it. There, we spawn the player, default gear, shadows, and play ability icons. Once that all has loaded, we transition to the real first layer. All the aforementioned objects are global, so they'll come over too.

actions.text: close the ability selector if we click anywhere that's not an ability or statue
when we click an ability that's not set to 'none'...
left mouse released instead of 'on click', so when the ability selector is closed after choosing an ability, the click isn't also registered and moves the player

children.name: abilityUID
children.comment: the ability's UID, use solely to set the glow effect

children.name: currentAbility
children.comment: the ability that's current chosen for the displayed class of abilities

children.name: selectedAbility
children.comment: The ability in the ability selector that was selected

children.name: currentCategory
children.comment: the class of abilities that's currently being displayed

actions.text: if it's on the ability bar...
if the class of the clicked ability is the one that's already being displayed, just close the ability selector
otherwise, open the ability selector and show the relevant abilities
populate the abilityOptionsArray with abilities that are of the matching class and meet the level requirement

TODO: If the player levels up with the ability selector open, any new abilities won't show up. Is it even possible to level up with the ability selector open? Should we just close the ability selector on level-up?
if we clicked on an ability option...

children.functionDescription: Turns the highlight of an ability cover on or off

functionParameters.name: on
functionParameters.comment: whether to turn the highlight on or off

actions.text: Only update the displayed value for coins when the inventory menu is visible, and the current amount isn't accurate.
you can only open regular menus when the settings menu isn't open, you currently aren't rearranging menus, there's no open dialog, and no other menus are currently fading in or out

children.functionDescription: Open or close a menu with a key.

functionParameters.name: menuName
functionParameters.comment: The name of the menu to manage.

children.functionDescription: Close the specified layer

functionParameters.name: menuName
functionParameters.comment: The name of the layer to close

actions.text: Prevent interaction with layer while it fades out. This is crucial to prevent interaction with menus that get closed by the settings menu opening up (and thus preventing exploits where gear/abilities could be managed while the game was paused)
Don't play the menu closing sound effect for the merchant menu, or while talking to an NPC, or while the menu open sound is playing.
This is used by the dialog window which doesn't have a statue

children.functionDescription: Open the specified layer

functionParameters.name: menuName
functionParameters.comment: The name of the layer to open

actions.text: The NPC dialog will play as soon as the dialog window opens, so the menu open sound wouldn't be necessary
somehow 'item - is DragDrop is dragging' is neither false nor true when no Items exist
TODO: Make sure this works with rings

children.name: typeForComparison
children.comment: The type of the gear that we want to compare

actions.text: if the item is in the inventory, compare to the relevant equipped item, if one exists
the "else" is for if we drag and hold an item over a loot

children.name: TOOLTIP_VERTICAL_PADDING
children.comment: How far to vertically pad the tooltip so it comfortably contains all its information, in pixels.

children.name: TOOLTIP_HORIZONTAL_PADDING
children.comment: How far to horizontally pad the tooltip so it comfortably contains all its information, in pixels.

children.name: TOOLTIP_VERTICAL_TEXT_PADDING
children.comment: How far to pad the tooltip description away from the rest of the tooltip info, in pixels.

children.functionDescription: update and show the tooltip with the specified information

functionParameters.name: value
functionParameters.comment: The value of the object to which for show the tooltip, in coins.

actions.text: Start at 1, to always skip the first token. Subtract 1, to make it 0-based. For each set of curly brackets, multiply the contents of that set by the player level.
set the color of the level and class restrictions text box depending if the player can use them. (evaluate with or operator wasn't working)
tooltipLore is along the bottom, so it's OK where it's at. Align everything above tooltipDescription, cascading upwards based on position. Subtract values, because we want to go up the Y, not down.
Set the tooltip's height based on the distance between the bottom of the tooltip and the bottom of the tooltipName, plus the tooltipName's textHeight, plus some padding.
We can't use the anchor behavior due to how this box dynamically resizes, so just set its Y every tick.
wait for the text to render. Using layer opacity or visibility will cause a stutter when changing text values

children.functionDescription: update and show the comparison tooltip with the specified information

functionParameters.name: value
functionParameters.comment: The value of the object for which to show the comparison tooltip, in coins.

actions.text: we can't compare abilities, so no boolean parameter for that
set the color of the level and class restrictions text box depending if the player can use them. (evaluate with or operator wasn't working)

children.text: see comments in the related events for the normal tooltip

actions.text: wait for the text to render. Using layer opacity or visibility will cause a stutter when changing text values

actions.text: The settings menu can't be opened while anything else is fading
If none of the abilityKeybinders are waiting to receive an input...
When a key is pressed, and there's an abilityKeybinder waiting to receive input...
...And the key that was pressed isn't already bound...

children.functionDescription: Close the settings menu.

actions.text: Only allow closure of the settings menu if we aren't currently rebinding a key
Yes, the for each is absolutely necessary here
This is so fades still work for statues when paused
For some reason this works, but tweening the opacity for showing/hiding menus doesn't. Probably something to do with the fact we're only going to 50 here, and we go to 0 there.

'toolip' and all overlay layers above can't be re-organized, all overlay layers beneath it can be reorganized. If we change layouts with this event enabled, overlay sprites get sent to the wrong layer (since global sprites go to their matching layout number, and re-organizing layers messes with their number).

The ability to dynamically sort layers would require a refactor of overlay layers to put all their content on one layer.

children.functionDescription: Move an enemy a certain direction in a certain angle. Already factors in isometry.

functionParameters.name: theAngle
functionParameters.comment: The angle along which the enemy should move. Already factors in isometry.

functionParameters.name: theDistance
functionParameters.comment: The distance the enemy will travel

actions.text: What happens when the enemy successfully arrives at their destination
If they successfully backed up, now the enemy will go left

children.text: Can't combine these two blocks because of how 'else' and OR blocks work.

actions.text: If they successfully went left, they're done; they can resume normal behavior
If they successfully went right, they're done; they can resume normal behavior
If they successfully backed up a second time, try turning left again (no need to record that this would be the 2nd left attempt)
If an enemy hit a solid while moving, they need to go somewhere else. They can't stop because they don't have an idle animation.
if the enemy wasn't already rerouting when he hit a solid, begin rerouting by backing up
If the enemy hit a solid while backing up, try going left
If the enemy hit a solid while going left, try going right. Go twice as far as normal to prevent loops
If the enemy hit a solid while going right, try backing up again
If the enemy hit a solid while backing up again, they are probably stuck. reset the rerouting process to try again
Extracting this out into a function results in enemies getting each other's angles
breaking angle(enemy.x, enemy.y, player.x, player.y) into a local variable doesn't work if we have more than 1 enemy.
Pick dead enemies and their bodies. Trim down the selection of enemies to only those who are parents of bodies that aren't playing a 'die' animation.

children.name: ENEMY_DEATH_FADE_OUT_TIME
children.comment: How long to fade out the body of a dead enemy, in seconds.

actions.text:
We could replace these with in-line waits based on the the length of the animation, but we would effectively lose the ability to change animation speeds while they were played.

Scenario: Enemy is currently hitstunned, and playing the hit animation. They get hit with another ability that reduces their action speed.

With in-line waits: Not possible, post-animation events would fire before the animation finished, resulting in many bugs.

With `on any animation finished' + find() trigger: post-animation events trigger correctly as they're initiated by a genuine trigger that runs only when an animation finishes.

children.name: PROJECTILE_SPEED

children.name: MANIFESTATION_POINT
children.comment: The longest possible distance (in pixels) between the enemy origin and where the projectile visual representation should appear. This is when they are facing directly left or right.

children.name: MANIFESTATION_FRAME
children.comment: The (0-based) frame in which the projectile should manifest

children.name: SIZE
children.comment: The size of the projectile

children.name: projectileManifestationTime
children.comment: How long it takes the projectile to get from the enemy's origin to the manifestation point

actions.text: The point in time when the projectile should appear differs based on which direction the enemy is facing. (i.e., the distance between the enemy's origin and hand is drastically different if he's facing left, vs. if he's facing up)
Time the spawning of the projectile so it will pass over the manifestation point during the same frame that the the projectile's visual representation on the enemy disappears.
Adjust the projectile's speed to account for isometry.
If we set the angle before we set the speed, and the speed of the template projectile is 0, this projectile will only flight straight left or right.
The projectile is now at the manifestation point. Spawn the projectile's visual representation.

actions.text: If the enemy was hit between the time when the attack started, but before the projectile was generated, cease continuation with the attack.

events.title: shadows
events.description: The player's shadows are global because we add them to a layout, check the 'global' checkbox, then delete them from that layout.

children.text: A 'for' loop over the shadows moving them behind their hasShadow didn't work, neither did the Z elevation hierarchy parameter.

actions.text: If this object already has a shadow, do nothing

children.text: If we change this boolean to affirm positive instead of negative (e.g., changing it to 'createShadow'), newly created hasShadows won't have shadows created for them since booleans for items that don't already exist on a layout are false.
Having a projectile object on the main menu in the margin prevents an issue where "bullet - set angle of motion" only ever sets the projectile's angle of motion to either 0 or 180.

actions.text: Projectiles are already destroyed when a layout ends because they aren't global. This quote-unquote 'natural' destroy takes place after this event sheet loses authority, so to speak, so the below event doesn't get to run. This event will trigger before we've completely transitioned off of the layout, so projectile audio will properly cease to play.
TODO: We want projectiles not to go through props, but this will destroy a projectile even if it lightly grazes a prop, that's not ideal

children.text: TODO: Add all other damage types

actions.text: Hitstun the enemy, as long as they aren't Unflinching and the projectile didn't kill them.
TODO: Can enemies get stunlocked?
destroy ranged projectiles owned by this enemy that: haven't been enabled (visually generated) yet, or are melee projectiles

children.name: playerHealthBeforeImpact
children.comment: The player's health before the projectile hit them.

actions.text: If the player is alive, isn't in a non-combat area, has an offHand item equipped, isn't currently blocking or getting hit, and successfully blocks the attack, play the block animation, then we're done.
destroy ranged projectiles owned by the player that: haven't been enabled (visually generated) yet, or are melee projectiles
If the projectile didn't get blocked...
If the player isn't currently blocking or getting hit, isn't in a non-combat area, and takes a hit that doesn't kill him, and that hit is bigger than the hitstun threshold, the player gets hitstunned
TODO: Attributes for the player (can they be unflinching?)
destroy ranged projectiles owned by the player that: haven't been enabled (visually generated) yet, or are melee projectiles

children.functionDescription: Check if the player is in range of a point.

functionParameters.name: range
functionParameters.comment: The length to which to compare the distance.

functionParameters.name: x
functionParameters.comment: The X coordinate of the location.

functionParameters.name: y
functionParameters.comment: The Y coordinate of the location.

parameters.value: Functions.isometrify(range, angle(player.X, player.Y, x, y)) >= distance(player.X, player.Y, x, y)

functionParameters.name: audioName

children.comment: The text to which we'll prepend the counter, to use for the audio tag.

actions.text: Silently play an audio file...

children.name: AUDIO_COUNTER_INCREMENTER
children.comment: How much to increase the counter when counting sound effect variations.

actions.text: If it exists, increase the counter and try again.
Stop the audio before recursively calling this function, otherwise we'll have a number of audio tracks being played equal to the depth of the call stack.
If it doesn't exist, return the counter; that's the total number of variants of this sound effect.

children.text: We can't pass boolean parameters between functions, so we have to evaluate the boolean parameter in events, and call the next function accordingly.

parameters.value: RegexReplace(RegexMatchAt(mod, CURLY_BRACKET_REGEX, GLOBAL_FLAG, index), EITHER_CURLY_BRACKET_REGEX, GLOBAL_FLAG, BLANK)

actions.text: save the bbox of the door on it's first frame, to be used to detect when the mouse is over it

Check that the mouse is within a box that's the shape of the door on the door's first frame. This prevents a graphical issue where the door would open enough so that the mouse would no longer be over the door, so the door would start to shut, thus being under the mouse again, repeat ad infinitum (and every tick)
If we mouse over two different doors very quickly, the animations might get messed up since this is an 'else', not sure
